intro: Senecio aurinitens, commonly known as the golden beard. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and dense, hairy foliage. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy inflorescences. Senecio aurinitens typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
